# makeRemoteTextureView(_:)

**Instance Method**

Creates a remote texture view for another GPU in the same peer group.

## Declaration

```swift
func makeRemoteTextureView(_ device: any MTLDevice) -> (any MTLTexture)?
```

## Discussion

The device instance that created this texture and the device instance passed into this method need to have the same nonzero peer group identifier ([doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice/peerGroupID]). This texture needs to either use the private storage mode ([doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLStorageMode/private]) or be backed by an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/IOSurface/IOSurface].

A remote view doesn’t allocate any storage for the new texture; it references the memory allocated for the original texture. You can use remote views only as a source for copy commands encoded by an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLBlitCommandEncoder]. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/transferring-data-between-connected-gpus].

## Creating views of textures on other GPUs

- **remoteStorageTexture**: The texture on another GPU that the texture was created from, if any.
